Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 73.7% similarity toMicasin-1Mol Wt:  4161.831; GRAVY: -0.339; mol formula: C174H276N54O52S6. 18% G, 15%C.Chemical modification:  Three disulfide bonds: Cys4-Cys25, Cys11-Cys33, and Cys15-Cys35.Activity:  Active against S. aureus AB94004 or ATCC25923 or ATCC6538 (MIC 0.06-0.25 uM), S. epidermidis AB208187 or AB208188 (MIC 4-8 uM), M. luteus AB93113 (MIC 0.06 uM), B. subtilis AB91021 (MIC 0.25 uM), MRSA (32 uM), G- E. coli AB94012 or ATCC25922 (MIC 0.06-0.25 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC9027 or ATCC27853 (MIC 0.06-0.25 uM), K. pneumoniae RM3017 (MIC 0.25 uM), C. albicans RM2018  (MIC 16 uM), and C. parapsilosis RM1003 (MIC 16 uM).Antimicrobial robustness: Salt-insenssitive; NaCl-insensitive:S. aureus (up to 450 mM).Toxicity: At 250 uM, low hemo.lysis (8%). Updated Jan2020; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Shen B, Song J, Zhao Y, Zhang Y, Liu G, Li X, Guo X, Li W, Cao Z, Wu Y.2018
Literature Information.Title: Triintsin, a human pathogenic fungus-derived defensin with broad-spectrum antimicrobial activity.
